title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, Appendices, app 7-D
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 16, Appendices, app 7-D
State Regulations
FORM A
STATE OF NEW YORK
PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION
REPORT OF SPECIFICATIONS OF PROPOSED CONSTRUCTION
OF
GAS PIPELINE TO BE SUBJECTED TO PRESSURE OF 125 PSIG OR
MORE
255.302
(Submitted in Triplicate)

Gas Corporation ____________ Date ____________
Route: From ____________ To ____________
New Construction ____________ Reconstruction
____________
Counties traversed ____________
Towns traversed ____________
Cities traversed ____________
Incorporated villages traversed ____________
Estimated date: Start of construction ____________
Completion of construction ____________
Identity of line (gas corporation name or number)
____________
Required filing: The following maps, sketches, and drawings
shall be filed with, and as part of, this report: (a) Two sets of current U.S. Geological

Survey maps (71/2 or 15-minute) sufficient to show the entire route of the
proposed construction or reconstruction and an area of one mile on either side
of the route. The route of the construction or reconstruction shall be clearly
indicated thereon, and
(b) Two sets
of strip maps and design drawings showing details of the proposed construction
or reconstruction. NOTE: Where more than one construction design factor is used, the specifications relative to each shall be separately listed. Where
necessary, supply the requested information on attached sheets identified by
the Roman numeral, number, and letter designation of the item on this
form. I. General

Length

Nominal outside diameter, "D", inches

Nominal wall thickness, "t", inches

Type and/or grade of pipe

Manufacturer of steel

Manufacturer of pipe

Type of longitudinal joint

Specified minimum yield strength, psi

Nominal ultimate strength, psi

Is pipe new or used?
If used pipe is employed, describe the inspection and
reconditioning

Mill test pressure, psi

Maximum certified operating pressure, psi

Calculated pipe stress (hoop stress)

Where PD = stress, psi
2t

Ratio of pipe stress to yield strength, percent

Check of pipe specifications: Are the physical and chemical specifications of pipe to be
verified by outside laboratories?
By whom?
(a) By class
locations, what percentage of the welds are to be radiographed?
By whom?
How will gas corporation certify the radiograph
technician?
II. Fabrication

What inspection procedures will be followed for detection of
gouges, grooves, and dents for: (a) Factory coated pipe
(b) Field
coated pipe
III. Railroad, road, and water crossings

Railroad crossings

List, giving location

Indicate whether cased or not; if not cased, provide
reason

Street or road crossings

List, giving location

Indicate whether cased or not

Indicate if heavier wall carrier pipe used

Lake, river, stream, or creek crossings

List, giving location

Describe any special construction precautions to be
followed

Pipeline encroachments

List any encroachments to railroads by location

List any encroachments to roads in which special construction
precautions will be employed; identify by location
IV. Valves

Manual valves

Number of sectionalizing valves

Spacing of sectionalizing valves

Type, make, and location of any automatic valves to be
used

Blowdown procedure

Describe method

Number, size, and location of blowdown valves

Estimated blowdown time for each section of pipeline
V. Minimum cover

If minimum prescribed cover cannot be maintained, indicate
location, nature of problem, and special precautions to observed
VI. Exposed piping and
self-supported spans other than on gas corporation property

Number of instances

Location of each

Reasons for exposed piping

Total length in each instance

Length of each self-supported span

Precautions taken (signs, fences, etc.)

What special precautions taken
VII. Corrosion control

Type of field coating: For pipe (if not factory coated)

For girth welds and fittings

Type of test of coating before backfill

Type of test of coating after backfill

Proposed cathodic protection
VIII. Pressure and leakage tests

Test pressure

Test medium

Duration of test

Length of test sections

What is the source of water supply used?
How and where is water disposed of after test?
IX. Purging of pipelines and mains

Description of purging procedure by class location
X. Route of pipeline

Has gas corporation obtained necessary R/W from each party
having interest in R/W? If not, what is status?
Has gas corporation obtained formal approval and all necessary
permits from governmental agencies? If not, what is status?
XI. Class locations

Supply full information for entire length of pipeline to
indicate basis of determination of class location of each segment thereof in
accordance with 16 NYCRR
255.5. XII. Odorizing provisions

Type of equipment to be installed

Type of odorant to be added

Threshold perception to be achieved (percent of
L.E.L.)
